Who are we? KIPP Memphis Collegiate Schools (KMCS) is a part of a national network of over 200 free, open-enrollment, college preparatory, public charter schools that prepare students for success in college and in life.KIPP Memphis began with one school in 2002; Today, we operate 8 schools â 3 Elementary, 4 Middle, & 1 High educating nearly 3,000 students in North Memphis and South Memphis. At our schools, students are proving that demographics do not define destiny. What do we do? KMCS builds a partnership among parents, students, and teachers that puts learning first. By providing outstanding educators, more time in school learning, and a strong culture of achievement, KMCS helps all students climb the mountain to and through college. Every day, KIPP students across the nation are proving that demographics do not define destiny. More than 86 percent of our students are from low-income families and eligible for the federal free or reduced-price meals program, and 95 percent are African American or Latino. Nationally, more than 90 percent of KIPP middle school students have graduated high school, and more than 80 percent of KIPP alumni have gone on to college. Why it matters? KIPP exists so that ALL children may reach their own potential and choose their own futures. We empower our students with the knowledge AND character traits necessary for success in college and life so that they will become lifelong learners and productive citizens giving back to their communities. The KMCS Regional Staff The KMCS regional staff oversees the quality, sustainability, and growth of KIPP schools in Memphis. The office provides a number of services to our KIPP schools including compliance, facilities management, finance and accounting, fundraising, human resources, marketing, operations, talent recruitment, and technology. The regional team also supports KMCS alumni in their journey to and through college, and provides support and coaching to school leadership teams. The goal of the regional office is to eliminate redundancies at the school level and create a more sustainable school environment, where the focus is on teaching and learning. KIPP Memphis Collegiate Schools 2670 Union Ave Extd. WEBTEXT: Tom Ryan â View Bio KIPP San Jose Collegiate will provide a rigorous, academic program to prepare students to enter and succeed in the nationâs finest four-year colleges and universities and the competitive world beyond. By building poised, confident, and articulate leaders, our graduates will use their education and life experiences to make positive change in their own lives, within the East San Jose community, and among our global society. KIPP San Jose Collegiate is a tuition-free, college-preparatory, public high school located in East San Jose. In August 2008, KIPP San Jose Collegiate opened its doors to all students from East San Jose who are committed to working hard to prepare for college and success in life. In 2012, KIPP San Jose Collegiateâs first class graduated. Ninety-five percent of its seniors were admitted to at least one four-year college or university. KIPP San Jose Collegiate is proving that its graduates will be prepared with the character and academic skills necessary to enter and succeed in four-year colleges and universities. 484 students, grades 9â12 76% Latino 19% Asian 2% African American 3% Other 8% English Language Learners 9% Students with Special Needs 76% qualify for federal free and reduced-price meals Please click here to review the 2012-13 SARC report for KIPP San Jose Collegiate. 1790 Educational Park Drive San Jose, CA 95133 Phone: (408) 937-3752 Fax: (408) 937-3755 Email: ksjc_info@kippbayarea.org Applications for the 2016-17 school year are now open. You can submit your online application here or visit the school to submit an application. WEBTEXT: Caroline Gifford â View Bio The mission of KIPP San Francisco College Preparatory is to prepare all students with the academic skills, knowledge, and strength of character to succeed in college and in the competitive world beyond. Through a rigorous college-preparatory curriculum that emphasizes critical thinking, analytical writing, and public speaking, students will be empowered to take ownership of their own education and achieve success not only as students, but also as active citizens engaged in their communities. KIPP San Francisco College Preparatory is a free, open-enrollment, public charter school open to all students in San Francisco. The new high school opened in the Fall of 2013 with 120 ninth grade students. Each year, the school will add a grade level until it becomes a ninth-through-twelfth grade high school in 2016. In 2017, members of the founding class will graduate and enroll in college. 312 students , Grades 9, 10, & 11 (growing to 9-12) 55% Latino 33% African American 7% Asian 5% Other 10%English Language Learners 10%Students with special needs 81% Students qualifying for free and reduced lunch KIPP San Francisco College Preparatory 1195 Hudson Avenue San Francisco, CA 94124 Phone: (415) 643-6951 Email: enrollment@kippsfcollegeprep.org 1195 Hudson Avenue San Francisco, CA 94124 Applications are open! We welcome all prospective students and their families to come tour our school. Please call(415)770-7633 to schedule a tour. Give us a call. Weâd love to tell you more about our school. Weâll call you. Please fill out this form for more information. CER_MS_2012: College-prep curriculum with an extended school day and longer school year. Provides students with the knowledge, critical thinking skills and character traits necessary to succeed and to lead productive lives.
WEBTEXT: Susana Mena âView Bio The mission of KIPP Heartwood Academy is to deepen in the students of East San Jose the knowledge, skills, character, and intellectual habits needed to excel in college and to make positive change every single day. KIPP Heartwood Academy is a free, open-enrollment, college-preparatory public charter middle school in San Jose. It opened its doors to 73 fifth grade students in July 2004, becoming the first public charter school in Alum Rock. By partnering with parents, teachers, community members, and the Alum Rock Union Elementary School District, KIPP Heartwood proves that with the necessary desire, discipline, and dedication, East San Jose students can perform at the same high levels as other students in Santa Clara County. KIPP Heartwood puts students on a solid track to success in high school, college, and the competitive world beyond. Our school derives its name from the redwood tree. The living tissue, or core, of a redwood tree is called the heartwood. When a redwood tree is damaged, it rebuilds itself from its heartwood. 406 students, grades 5â8 80% Latino 19% Asian 1% Other 23% English Language Learners 6% Students with Special Needs 82% qualify for federal free and reduced-price meals 1250 South King Road San Jose, CA 95122 Phone: (408) 926-5477 Fax: (408) 926-5478 Email: kha_info@kippbayarea.org Applications for the 2016-17 school year are now open for Grades 5-8. You can submit your online application here . SEARCH: INVICTUS HIGH SCHOOL 3120 EUCLID AVE, CLEVELAND, OH
WEBTEXT: Jump to navigation Everything in our lives can be personalized â our phone ringers and cases, Facebook status, clothes, and our playlists. Everything except how we learn. Today that changes! Invictus High School allows students to choose when they go to school and which courses they work on each day. The schedule is designed to fit your life. Courses are self-paced to allow students to accelerate their learning. It's a real diploma for 21st century students â and it's free. Invictus is now serving three locations: 3122 Euclid Avenue, Cleveland, OH44115 3969 Lee Road , Cleveland, OH44128 7099 W 130th St. Parma Heights, OH 44130 To enroll now, click here. Invictus will be conducting a trip to Southern Ohio to take students on a three-school visit on October 20,2016. The trip will stop at: Meet with your teacher if you are interested in attending. The Cleveland Browns generously made a number of tickets available to Invictus Students to attend several games this year. IHS student Faleia Wilson spotted JR Smith from our National Champion Cavaliers in the stands! Faleia definitely deserved the tickets as she had the highest GPA of any Invictus student participating in the Gateway Program with Tri C. She will be qualified for scholarships and membership in some elite organizations because of her work. Invictus Students enjoyed a trip to Cleveland's Federal Reserve Bank on August 30, 2016. The students enjoyed the tour a great deal, and learned a lot about our financial institutions. The staff at the Federal Reserve Bank was impressed with the engaged and attentive students from Invictus. The tour guide let Mr. Fasig know that the students of Invictus asked more and better questions than virtually any of the other schools they had seen. Over the summer, Invictus staff all volunteered at the Clevelad Kids Book Bank. The staff all helped the Book Bank by sorting and boxing books for distribution to schools and the "Little Free Libraries" all around Cleveland. http://www.cccvoice.com/2016/03/12/4199/ Click on the link to read about an Invictus Student succeeding in College via the Gateway program with Tri-C. In an effort to improve system practices, Cambridge Education Group is conducting a Parent Survey. We value your opinion and ask that you take the time to complete this survey. In order to complete the survey, please click on the link below . Please be assured that your responses to this survey will be anonymous. Your honest opinion is appreciated. Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. 3122 Euclid Ave. Cleveland, OH 44115 3969 Lee Rd. WEBTEXT: 4th Grade Students Earn Award for Work to Protect Watershed Students in our 4th grade received the Schuylkill Drinking Water Award from the Schuylkill Action Network as part of their yearlong efforts to protect the local watershed. Their project included learning about the waterways in our region, raising trout in the classroom, and marking storm drains in the neighborhood to help raise awareness about waterways in our area. Watch the video here! WEBTEXT: We are focused on graduating students and fully preparing them for college. In addition, Green Dot is dedicated to helping parents organize and expect more of their neighborhood schools. We achieve better student outcomes and higher graduation rates serving students who need the most, lower per-pupil funding, and a unionized workforce. We arethe leading independent non-profit public school operator in Los Angeles andone of the top three largest in the nation. The U.S. Department of Education has featured Green Dot as a national leader in school turnarounds, and we are the only school network in the country to leadthe turnaround of a large high school (3,000+ students) "Green Dot reminds me why I grew up wanting to be a teacher. I feel like I'm working toward something bigger here, and I believe in what we're doing every day." - William Heuisler, History Teacher At Green Dot, our mission is to help transform public education so ALL students graduate prepared for college, leadership, and life. We make this possible by hiring passionate teachers, administrators, and staff who believe in our students' potential. IsGreen Dot right for you? Green Dot Public Schools is a network of public charter schools in Los Angeles, California; Memphis, Tennessee; and Tacoma, Washington. Our middle schools offer grades six to eight, and our high schools offer grades nine to 12. Our schools are free and open to all students, like other public schools. Our Approach. Green Dotâs academic model is designed to meet individual student needs, combining a rigorous curriculum with the academic counseling and support students need to succeed. Our Results. Now serving more than 12,000 students, Green Dothas graduated more than 6,500 students with more than 90% of our graduating seniors being accepted to college. Our API scores show sustained student growth and U.S. News and World Report has ranked our schools among the very best in the nation. Each Green Dot school shares the common mission of preparing our students for college, leadership and life . Helpopen great public schools thatdeliver on the promise of closing historic achievement gaps, and give all students an equal opportunity to succeed incollege, leadership and life . Eight Green Dot high schools are ranked among the top 10% of schools nationally by US News & World Report , with four being in the top 5%. Students enter Green Dot schools testing in the bottom 10% but are matching the graduation rate for the state. These same students are 4 times more likely to graduate college-ready than students in neighboring schools. As a dropout prevention and recovery school established in 2003, Glass City Academy has given great attention to designing a curriculum that meets State of Ohio requirements as well as offering challenging classes for all students.. WEBTEXT: Jump to navigation Click here to enroll today East Preparatory Academy, serving grades K-8, is dedicated to improving the lives of its students by providing authentic learning experiences in a collaborative, nurturing environment that will build a foundation for students success in school, at future work, and in life. To achieve the mission, our School will integrate current learning technologies into the classroom, offer authentic learning experiences that are respectful of how children learn best, and offer a schedule and support activities that enable each student to achieve to his or her potential. We want our students to leave the School with the skills and abilities necessary to achieve academic excellence, personal growth, and success as lifelong learners. This mission requires the support of the faculty, staff, families, and community in order to encourage and empower students to be responsible and valued citizens. East Preparatory Academy is extremely proud to be named School of the Year 2016! Please note that the East Preparatory Academy Board of Directors next meeting is scheduled for: Thursday, August 5, 2016 5:00 PM And will be held at: Capella High School 5130 Warrensville Center Rd. WEBTEXT: Home Quality School Mission, Vision & Values Quality Education		 > Character Education Curriculum Special Education Technology Photo Gallery Mission, Vision & Values Quality Education		 > Character Education Curriculum Special Education Technology Character Education Curriculum Special Education Technology Photo Gallery Enroll Resources Back-to-School Information Student and Parent Links Policies		 > Attendance Dress Code Child Find Schedule Transportation Tutoring Back-to-School Information Student and Parent Links Policies		 > Attendance Dress Code Child Find Attendance Dress Code Child Find Schedule Transportation Tutoring News & Events Calendar Newsletters and Menus Calendar Newsletters and Menus About Us Board of Directors School Leader & Staff School Performance The Leona Group Region Board of Directors School Leader & Staff School Performance The Leona Group Region Contact Careers Careers Challenging curriculum aligned to the Common Core and Ohio Revised Standards Structured classroom environments Free breakfast and lunch programs Technology integration in all classrooms Variety of extracurricular activities and sports programs Free transportation Welcome to Eagle Academy! Eagle Academy is a tuition-free community school serving grades 6-9. The mission of Eagle Academy, where kids come first, is to partner with the families to transform the learning process with technology-infused projects and focused instructional strategies that promote enthusiastic learners and high student achievement. Eagle Academy offers the following: Challenging curriculum aligned to the Common Core and Ohio Revised Standards Structured classroom environments Free breakfast and lunch programs Technology integration in all classrooms Variety of extracurricular activities and sports programs Free transportation Eagle Academy College/Career Expo Eagle Academy College/Career Expo On Friday, October 16, 2015, the students at Eagle Academy participated in a college and career expo! The expo is our signature recruiting event here at Eagle Academy, which allows students to meet recruiters from a variety of industries. The expo featured colleges, universities, technical schools, and internship options both locally and regionally. CER_MS_2012: Computer based program
WEBTEXT: e-Institute is a FREE charter school that offers an excellent alternative opportunity for high school completion. Our computer based programs are aligned with the Arizona State Standards and offer the latest in educational assessment, guided practice, enhancement and remedial course studies. In addition, we also offer classes in the traditional setting such as; AIMS reading, writing, and math prep courses. We provide a self-pace setting thatâs ideal for students who want to speed up their graduation date or catch up on credits. Our flexible schedule makes it convenient for those students who have jobs or other responsibilities. We have two-four hour sessions five days a week. Our e-Institute Charter High Schools conveniently serve 6 valley locations . For all locations, call (602) 870-2000. NCA Parent "I like the flexible schedule because I can stay home, work at my own pace, and get help from my great teachers when I need it." Middle School Student "I love teaching at Nevada Connections Academy because each student is treated individually, and our incredible technology allows us to customize the program for each student." Secondary School Teacher 	Students throughout Nevada are thriving at Nevada Connections Academy (NCA), a tuition-free virtual public school that gives students the flexibility to learn with a curriculum that meets rigorous state education standards. 	Nevada Connections Academy offers: Teachers, parents and students of our virtual school in Nevada explain how online learning at Nevada Connections Academy works and why they appreciate the tight knit school community offering all the services and resources that create a well-rounded student experience. 	NCA is not just an exceptional Nevada virtual school. Itâs a tight knit school community offering all the services and resources that create a well-rounded student experience: 	The mission of Nevada Connections Academy is to help each student maximize his or her potential and meet the highest performance standards through a uniquely individualized learning program at our virtual school in Nevada. 	Want more information about the Nevada Connections Academy virtual school program? Enrollment is now open.	 		Online and in-person information sessions and events are great ways to learn more about Connections Academy.	 		Weâll send you a catalog in the mail, as well as emails with great information about the program, curriculum, extracurricular activities, teachers, students, and more. Nevada Connections Academy 	(NCA) is a free public online school serving students in grades Kâ12 throughout Nevada. 2016â17 School Year 	Start: August 29, 2016	 	End: June 9, 2017 Nevada Connections Academy is accredited by theNorthwest Accreditation Commission (NWAC), an accrediting division of 	 AdvancED . Information A challenging K-12 curriculum developed by leading education experts. Instruction from state-certified teachers experienced in online instruction. Support from trained counselors, principals, and administrative staff. Free textbooks, curriculum materials, and computer equipment needed to participate in a dynamic online learning environment. Dedicated highly qualified teachers who, in addition to their teaching duties, travel the state for school field trips, locally-based state test administration, field days, social events, and more. A national Connections Academy peer-to-peer tutoring program where students can receive one-on-one assistance in a LiveLesson Â® virtual classroom . Extensive writing workshops to help students in grades 5, 8, and 11 master the skills needed for academic success and state testing requirements. Weekly âLunch Bunchâ gatherings throughout the state where students, families, and teachers connect for games, lunch, and conversation. Dozens of clubs and activities that foster social development and academic growth. An involved community of students and their families. Attend an upcoming Nevada Connections Academy information session . Find out how to enroll in our Nevada virtual school. Teaching center and administrative office in Reno. The top-rated Kâ12 Virtual School in Nevada. Over 93% of NCA parents agree that the Connections Academy curriculum is high quality. View our parent survey results. SEARCH: OAK LEADERSHIP INSTITUTE 8610 HOUGH AVE, CLEVELAND, OH
CER_NAME: OAK Leadership Institute | Cleveland Transformation Alliance
WEBTEXT: OAK Leadership Institute is a community school located in Clevelandâs historic Hough neighborhood. OAK is the acronym for âOvercome Anything for Kids.â Serving children in grades K-8, OAK Leadership Institute is a nurturing learning community that inspires and supports young leaders who can define and achieve their own success. Central to OAKâs mission is the recognition and appreciation that learning differences are gifts, that each individual student processes information differently, and that diversity is a component of excellence. Educators at OAK incorporate multisensory activities in the general education classroom to create an optimal learning environment for every student in the classroom to enjoy learning and experience success. At OAK, educators truly know their students, as learners and as individuals. Students at OAK are taught and empowered to make choices, think critically and creatively, develop ownership of their learning, and become self-advocates and agents of change. Through the Peace First movement, students at OAK are becoming the next generation of peacemakers who can create positive change around them. Students are taught to work effectively with others to resolve conflicts, solve community problems, communicate ideas effectively, and form positive social relationships. As students progress through the curriculum at each developmental level, from Kindergarten through 8th grade, they develop the courage and compassion they need to see themselves as leaders and to act with empathy toward others. Highlighted Academic Offerings Student Engagement and Activities Parent & Community Involvement Student Resources and Services Technology Technology is integrated in the classroom as an instructional tool and to help students improve their technology skills. Each classroom is equipped with desktop computers, Chromebooks and interactive whiteboards to facilitate and enhance learning. A or B on each measure. These Kâ8 schools show strong overall performance and students outpace peers (students with similar academic performance histories) statewide. These high schools are strong in overall performance and graduation rate. C or better on each measure. Students at these Kâ8s show moderate to strong performance but their year-to-year academic growth is only on par with their peers around the state or they outpace peers but perform at the state average.For these high schools, performance and graduation rates are average or better (e.g. one A, one C). A, B or C on one measure, D or F on the other. These schools are failing on one measure and meeting or exceeding expectations on the other. Kâ8s may be performing at the state average or better but are being outpaced by their peers across the state or overall performance is very low but students are on par with or outpacing peers. At these high schools, overall performance is at least average, but graduation rates are low or vice versa.At these high schools, overall performance is at least average, but graduation rates are low or vice versa. D or F on both measures. Students at these Kâ8 schools are both performing at low levels and failing to keep pace with their peers across the state.Students at these high schools are performing at low levels and too few are graduating. Detailed information about district and school progress, such as student performance, enrollment and graduation rate. This grade combines two results for students who took the state tests. The first result answers the question - How many students passed the state test? The second result answers the question - How well did the students do on the state test? Performance Index shows how well all of the students in the school did on every state test. Indicators Met shows how many of the state tests were passed by at least 75 percent of the students who took them. Value-Added shows how many 4th-8th grade students made at least one year's worth of academic growth (C). Schools where students made more than one year's worth of academic growth receive a higher grade. Schools where students made less than one year's worth of growth receive a lower grade. This measures the progress for all students in math and reading, grades 4-8. This measures the progress for students identified as gifted in reading, math, and/or superior cognitive ability. This measures the progress for students identified as the lowest 20% statewide in reading and math achievement. This measures the progress for students with disabilities. WEBTEXT: Welcome to Chandler Park Academy Elementary School. MESSAGE FROM THE PRINCIPAL It is my pleasure to welcome you to Chandler Park Academy-Elementary (CPA-E)! We are extremely proud of our ever-evolving school, as we strive for excellence. Our primary goal in elementary school is to help each child achieve his/her personal best both academically and socially. In partnership with home, we believe we will achieve academic excellence. You are the most essential part of your childâs education and it is vital that we build a strong relationship in order to best serve your child. Likewise, your input and involvement is greatly appreciated as we work to accomplish our school goals. As we begin a new academic year it is important to remember how we begin our year. The attitudes we develop and the effort we make, can determine our progress and success for the duration of the school year. CPA-E family is committed to academic excellence by creating a school environment where daily respect and cooperation is the expected norm, and teachers use preventative and supportive classroom strategies to foster a positive and healthy learning environment. Thank you in advance for your support and cooperation. Again, we look forward to establishing a long-lasting and rewarding relationship with you and your family. Please remember my door is always open to you and that I welcome your questions, concerns, and input. Sincerely, Mrs. Marian Flaggs Principal Mr.Andre Anderson Assistant Principal Ms.NaTashia Carter Assistant Principal Mr. Devon Banks Academic Liason Click here to download Elementary School Our primary goal in elementary school is to help each child achieve his/her personal best both academically and socially. In partnership with home, we believe we will achieve academic excellence. You are the most essential part of your childâs education and it is vital that we build a strong relationship in order to best serve your child. Likewise, your input and involvement is greatly appreciated as we work to accomplish our school goals. As we begin a new academic year it is important to remember how we begin our year. The attitudes we develop and the effort we make, can determine our progress and success for the duration of the school year. WEBTEXT: Openingin 2017...A state-of-the-art performing and teaching arts theatre! Visit www.ccpcs.org/theatre to support the theatre today! We strive to ensure that our children learn not just reading, math and science, but also compassion, service and community. Karen Dresden, Founder and Head of School At Capital City, every student is college material, and the goal is to get the very best education possible. Michelle Obama, First Lady of the United States Being a scholar at Capital City makes you feel like you are part of a community that is always pushing you to go above and beyond. Miguel P., Valedictorian,Class of 2015 Capital City's exceptional faculty encourages students to be self-motivated learners. Everywhere I turned I saw a thoughtful, joyful approach to teaching, learning and inquiry. Denis Udall, The William and Flora Hewlett Foundation Our educators spend their breaks engaging in various professional development opportunities to grow their teaching practice. Capital City isone of only 10 schoolsto be named a CTE Makeover Challenge Winner by the U.S. Department of Education. At Capital City, completing middle school involves an unusual requirement: convincing a panel of strangersthat you are readyfor high school. Capital City was the only school in Washington, DC to be honoredas a 2016 U.S. Dept. ofEducation Green Ribbon School. Thanks to their expedition âSave the Bayâ, 5th graders participated in conservation efforts to restore the Chesapeake Bay. WEBTEXT: Advisory Committee on Special Education (ACSE) awards the Grazer Outstanding Achievement in Learning Award (GOAL)							 								Camino Nuevo Charter Academy's very own, Rachel Hazelhurst, is featured in this Atlantic article, discussing the success of our bilingual programs and the connection between celebrating our students' ethnic roots and academic achievement.							 								How does poverty and trauma affect student learning? KPCC 89.3 FM featured Camino Nuevo and how our unique approach is making a difference in students' lives.							 					We are about to embark on a special celebration for the entire Camino Nuevo community. I invite you to continue to grow, learn, and celebrate with us! I am incredibly proud of all that we have accomplished. Our students, parents, staff, and many partners have been amazing in ensuring that we continue to provide our students with the quality education they deserve. I invite you to join me in celebrating all our accomplishments and look forward to connecting with you in what promises to be an EXTRA special year for Camino Nuevo Charter Academy this fall! Notice: The California Department of Education ("CDE") has requested that local educational agencies throughout the State post the following link to CDE's website www.cde.ca.gov/morganhillcase to provide parents notice of thedisclosure of student recordspursuant to a Court Order issued in a lawsuit filed by the Morgan Hill Concerned Parents Association and the Concerned Parent Association against the CDE. (Case No.2:11-cv-3471-KJM-AC). The CDE website provides aNoticefor your review and anObjection Formshould you wish to object to the disclosure of your child's personally identifiable information. If you have any questions please visit CDE's website at www.cde.ca.gov/morganhillcase or contact CDE at (916) 319-0800. The Camarillo Academy of Progressive Education, or CAPE , is Ventura County's independent public school. CAPE currently serves students in grades kindergarten through eighth. CAPE is located at 777 Aileen Street, Camarillo, California, at the school site formerly known as Valle Lindo. For more information, call (805) ) 384-1415. The Mission of Camarillo Academy of Progressive Education Charter School is to foster global, independent, creative thinkers who feel confident in themselves, are willing to take risks, and work cooperatively. Together the parents, students, and teachers create a progressive environment that sparks imagination, ignites a love for learning, and encourages each individual to be and do the best that he/she can; enabling pupils to become self-motivated, competent, and life-long learners, equipped for the challenges of the 21st Century. WEBTEXT: PLEASE NOTE THAT THE JULY'S BOARD MEETING HAS BEEN CANCELLED. The Board will meet as scheduled on Wednesday, August 10, 2016, at 6:30pm at the Boggs School. May's board meeting will be held on Wednesday, May 11, at 6:30 at the Boggs School. This meeting is open to the public. April's board meeting will be held on Wednesday, April 13, at 6:30 at the Boggs School. This meeting is open to the public. March's board meeting will be held on Wednesday, March 9, at 6:30pm at the Boggs School. This meeting is open to the public. The school tour scheduled for March 15 has been cancelled. We do not currently have plans to reschedule but will keep you posted. With heavy hearts, we want to share the passing of Grace Lee Boggs on Oct. 5. She was 100 years old. Our school community will miss her deeply. GraceInArticle.jpg Are you a certified teacher? Do you want to come join a fantastic team? We are accepting applications and are currently conducting interviews. See our application instructions here ! Many others are helping the Boggs School to tell its story. To read and view their journalistic and artistic pieces, click HERE ! Did you know our students wrote and published a book illustrated by renowned author Dave Eggers ? Read more HERE ! We still have a few for sale! WEBTEXT: Bay Haven Charter Academy, INC. What do we believe and what are we all about? We are compelled by state law to teach the FSA (Florida Standard Assessments) which are the controversial Core Curriculum Standards you have read about with just a small number of adjustments. However, we teach beyond the standards and we firmly believe in setting expectations for our learners based upon a powerful work ethic. There is a demand for rigor and a process/product based approach. This is an organization of conservative values and powerful support for our military with the knowledge that not all students go to or need to go to college. Many need to move toward careers that better suit their lifeâs goals. However, our college preparatory program is dynamic with Advanced Placement and Dual Enrollment courses along with a middle school Pre-AP program. We also offer the SAIL (Studies in Advanced and Innovative Learning) Program in our high school. North Bay Haven and Bay Haven schools are consistently (for 13 years) ranked in the top 10% of all traditional and charter public schools in the State of Florida. We have the highest FCAT and EOC (End of Course) exams scores in Bay County every year in practically every subject at every grade level. Please visit our Foundation site at http://bhcafoundation.org/ to learn more about supporting our schools. Thank you. 								There will be no school on Thursday or Friday, September 1st and 2nd, 2016. Please be safe!							 								There will be a meeting of the BHCA, Inc. Board of Directors on Thursday, September 8th at 4:00 p.m. at the Bay Haven campus in the media center.							 								At Camo Dreams, Inc. we are dedicated to providing once in a lifetime outdoor opportunities to deserving children with disabilities or terminal illnesses. Labels for Education and Giant A+ School Rewards Program Please support these school programs by collecting UPCs and beverage/sauce caps from participating products [www.labelsforeducation.com/Earn-Points/Participating-Products] and registering your Giant Food Store Bonus card. Go to http://giantfoodstores.com/savings-and-rewards/rewards-program/aplus/ for set up and information. WEBTEXT: Blackfoot Charter Elementary Blackfoot Charter Middle School The mission of the Blackfoot Charter Community Learning Center is to know each student well enough to challenge and meet their individual academic and developmental needs. This is accomplished through a goal-driven environment that includes multi-grade classrooms, small groups, interactive technology, and brain based learning. These are supported by a high level of teacher collaboration and professional development. Did you know that Blackfoot Charter School: School Hours: Monday thru Thursday 8:30 a.m. to 3:15 p.m. *Picture Day* Wednesday, September 28th It is the policy of BCCLC not to discriminate on the basis of sex, race, color, national origin, religion, disabilities, or any other legally protected class(es) as defined by applicable state and federal law, in its education programs, activities, admissions, access, treatment, or employment practices. WEBTEXT: Today's Choice for Tomorrow's Future Our mission at Bayshore Preparatory Charter School is to educate K-12 students through a rigorous college prep curriculum in a flexible, student-centered learning environment. Our goal is to actively partner with students, parents, and the community to support studentsâ academic success and personal goals. Bayshore is atuition-free, open-enrollment public school. Students are accepted regardless of background or academic record on a first-come, first-served basis. If more students apply than spaces are available, students are admitted by lottery. To enroll your child, please contact usdirectly by phone or email. Latest Announcements: Thank you San Marcos Community Foundation !We received a $1000 mini grant to take a field trip kayaking in La Jolla and to the Birch Aquarium for 9-12graders. Bayshore Preparatory is accredited by the Western Association of School and Colleges (WASC). Bayshore does not discriminate on the basis of race, color, gender, disability, age, religion, sexual orientation, or national or ethnic origin. Copyright Â© 2015 The Bay Group. All rights reserved. CER_MS_2012: Self-paced, individualized instruction, peer teaching, cooperative learning and integrated curriculum.
WEBTEXT: Appleton Public Montessori (APM) is located at 1545 East Broadway Drive, Appleton, WI 54913. We are a charter school within the Appleton Area School District . Our school was started in 2005 to fill a need in the community for an authentic Montessori Elementary School.We started with two classrooms and have grown over the years to have five classrooms. The Montessori method is a child centered approach utilizing multi-aged classrooms. Each of our rooms offer a prepared environment with specific, hands on, sequential materials. Each child contributes to their learning or work plan by selecting work and concentrating on it for up to three hours during work time. Our students programing also includes Spanish, performing and visual arts and physical and environmental education. We have many goals for the children at APM, but most of all we hope they âlearn to love to learn.â No qualified person with a disability will, because the Districtâs facilities are inaccessible to or unusable by persons with disabilities, be denied the benefits of, be excluded from participation in, or otherwise be subjected to discrimination under any program or activity to which Section 504/ADA applies. As to facilities, the District will conduct its programs or activities so that, when viewed in their entirety, they are readily accessible to disabled persons. To the extent a program or activity is now held in an inaccessible location, it will be moved to an accessible location upon request. A Federal grant in the amount of 3.8 million dollars has allowed contractors to begin construction on Phase I of the new All Tribes Charter School. Due to high bids, the job has been seperated into two Phases, I & 2. Phase I is expected to be completed by December 2014 so students will be in the new campus for the second semester. WEBTEXT: The Classical Academy Dear TCA Community, Welcome to the upcoming 2016-17 school year, and to our new and improved website! Regarding the school year, I'd like to once again say thank you for journeying with me as we assist parents in helping our students become extraordinary. As always, there are exciting, unique, and wonderful things happening at TCA, and as we approach the first few days of school and beyond, I look forward to updating you periodically, while exploring all that TCA has to offer. And, to help us communicate the exciting, unique, and wonderful, please spend a minute or two browsing our new website, and come back frequently. I think you'll find it to be user friendly, informative, and...timeless. Just like the rest of our amazing school. Thank you again for being a part of our wonderful community. And, WELCOME to the new school year! WE ARE TITANS! Russ Sojourner This is a select listing of events at TCA. To get a full list of all events across all campuses, please see our full TCA Event Calendar by clicking here . We welcome you with the spirit of Aloha! Gallery Contact Us We are Voyagers like ancestors of old. We are strong, inventive, courageous, and filled with wonder. Sailing seas of knowledge, we seek understanding and use it with compassion. Looking forward, we honor the past to better see our future. We will find hope and success in spite of wind and change. We offer students an accelerated back-to-basics and traditional education that provides them with a traditional foundation for the future. Painted Rock Academy is a tuition-free public charter school within the Reid Traditional Schools family. Our schools have been consistently ranked among the best schools in Arizona. Our Mission: To offer back-to-basics , traditional education byproviding a challenging, sequential, teacher-directed, standards-based, textbook-driven curriculum supported by individual accountability and high academic and behavioral standards . The report card on Painted Rock Academy is in, and we earned A rating â again! The Arizona Department of Education letter grades for the 2013-14 school year have been announced, and, as always, Reid Traditional Schoolsâ Painted Rock Academy and Reid Traditional Schoolsâ Valley Academy both received an âAâ letter grade. ADDRESS: 3500 WEST CORTARO FARMS RD, TUCSON, AZ
CER_MS_2012: Provide motivated students with the opportunity to achieve academic excellence in an accelerated, back-to-basics, safe learning environment.
WEBTEXT: Legacy Traditional School in NW Tucson, AZ is an âAâ ranked school by the Arizona Department of Education and has been voted the #1 charter school in Arizona by Ranking Arizona. Legacy Traditional School believes every student deserves the benefit and reward of a quality, well-rounded education. One that focuses on all areas of academic study, including music, art, physical education, extracurricular activities and clubs. Legacys back-to-basics and accelerated curriculum is encompassed in a learning environment that focuses on character building, patriotism, and the responsibilities of being a good citizen. Legacy Traditional School is a K-8 charter school with state-of-the-art classrooms for kindergarten, elementary and middle school (jr. high). Legacy also offers after school and summer programs that are an extension of their academics. SEARCH: MOTT HALL CHARTER SCHOOL 1260 FRANKLIN AVE, BRONX, NY
CER_MS_2012: Longer instructional day and year, service learning, liberal arts program. Will expand to 6-8.
WEBTEXT: The mission of the Mott Hall Charter School is to prepare our scholars in mind, body, and character to succeed in top high schools, colleges, and careers by becoming inquisitive, open-minded, and compassionate citizens of the world. At MHCS we believe that in order to be successful we must provide a holistic educational experience, tending to the developing mind, body, and character of our young scholars. Only in this way will we be preparing leaders for the 21st century. Under the guidance of a skilled coaching staff, Mott Hall offers a wide variety of after school athletic clubs and teams for both boys and girls including soccer, flag football, basketball and more. These opportunities not only help our scholars stay healthy they also provide college bound skills. Through our core values we teach our scholars the character skills to overcome the obstacles they face to being successful in life. These core values are Responsibility, Integrity, Scholarship, and Excellence. Scholars are introduced to these attributes from the moment they walk through our door and our values are reinforced throughout their time at Mott Hall through our school culture, our RISE Incentive Program, and our school affirmation. Our behavior and discipline approach provides an age-appropriate response to scholar misbehavior. We set firm limits for acceptable behavior and help teach scholars to make the right choices for themselves. When they do not we provide additional opportunities for them to practice the skills they need in small group and one-on-one settings. To foster a learning community free of distraction Mott Hall upholds a strict uniform policy. The policy is strictly enforced, with scholars expected to be in full uniform whenever they are on school grounds. Amendments to the uniform are only allowed for medical or religious reasons. Wearing our uniform each day reflects all four of our schoolâs core values of responsibility, integrity, scholarship, and excellence. Click here to access the uniform website Our after school program allows scholars to pursue an interest and build skills in activities they can pursue in high school and college. These activities include visual art, music, theater, dance, STEM (Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics), Basketball, Football, and Soccer. We are seeking scholars interested in rising to the challenge of gaining entry into a top high school and ultimately going to college. These are young people who are willing to develop the core values of responsibility, integrity, scholarship, and excellence and demonstrate these values by wearing their uniform proudly, completing their homework every night, seeking out help from teachers and other adults when they need it, and developing college bound skills and interests through our enrichment program. If you are ready to rise to this challenge Mott Hall is for you. Each year Mott Hall Charter School accepts 90 rising 6th graders eligible to enroll in New York City schools with admissions preference given to students residing in Community School District 9 where the school is located. All applicants must be residents of New York State at the time of application and must be able to demonstrate residency through proper identification. We accept rising 7th and 8th grade scholars on a limited basis given seat availability. We strongly encourage all interested families to attend an Information Session to learn more about Mott Hall Charter School. Throughout the year Mott Hall holds these sessions on weekday evenings and Saturdays for families to learn more about the key features of the school, what is takes to be a successful Mott Hall scholar, and what we expect of our parents. Clickthe button belowto see upcoming Information Session dates and times. Mott Hall Charter School will schedule exclusive presentations for individual schools and community organizations serving rising 6th graders. To schedule a visit to Mott Hall or if you would like us to present at your school or site please contact us. To learn more about our school and the admissions process or to schedule a visit or get an application contact our admissions team by clicking here . Mott Hall Charter School seeks teachers committed to helping us build a legacy of educational excellence who possess the following: We recruit staff year-round, so if you meet the criteria above and would like to join our team please contact us . The Mott Hall Charter School Board of Trustees ensures the schoolâs success by providing academic, operational, fiscal, and legal oversight and support, and holding the school accountable for the achievement of its performance and outcome goals. To view the calendar of Mott Hall Charter School annual Board meetings click the button below. All Board meetings are held at Mott Hall Charter School (Annex Building, 1260 Franklin Avenue, Bronx, NY 10456) is a member of the Principal Investments team at a top real estate private equity firm. Prior to joining her current firm, Ms. Smalling worked within Deutsche Bankâs Corporate Investment Bank and Private Wealth Management Division. Ms. Smalling graduated with high honors from Harvard University with a Bachelors of Arts in History and Science and a language citation in French. Ms. Smalling is a native of the Bronx. is the Director of Human Resources at Programs for Parents, Inc., (PfP) a not-for-profit organization which works to ensure that children get the best possible start in life. A former Vice President of Human Capital Management at Goldman Sachs, she led the Global Leadership and Diversity efforts for the Americas. Ms. Thompson holds a Masters of Public Administration, Advanced Management and Finance from Columbia University. While many of our scholars are admitted to top catholic, private and boarding schools their families often cannot afford even the reduced tuition they must pay to attend. Our Scholarship fund makes it possible. Make a one time, recurring, or multi-year gift to support M o tt Hall â s greatest needs . Double or even triple your gift through your or your spouse/partnerâs company gift matching program Each year we have scholars whose lives are shaken when a parent falls sick or loses their job. When this happens families may not be able to buy our school uniform, afford groceries, keep the lights and heat on, or pay the rent. LIFT Fund monies are used to support MHCS families in need. Make a gift of appreciated securities. Securities donors receive a tax deduction and offer the additional benefit of avoiding capital gains taxation. Include Mott Hall Charter School in your estate, retirement, or insurance plans.To plan or make a gift contact us at RISE@motthallcs.org or click here . We are located at 1260 Franklin Avenue in the Morrisania neighborhood of the South Bronx. We are accessible by the B or D trains (167th Street stop), the 2 or 5 trains (Freeman Avenue stop), and the Bx 35 Bus. Our siteincludes a library, cafeteria, outdoor yard, and indoor mini-gym. We are located across the street from Bronx Lebanon Hospital and are a short walk from beautiful Crotona Park. Morrisania is primarily comprised of families of Dominican, Central American, African American, and West African descent and our school reflects this diversity of cultures. Parent support groups College Readiness Personalized high school vision plan for every scholar. High School placement and application assistance Top performing high school and college visits Test Preparation Partnerships with high school placement programs such as Prep for Prep and the Boys Club of New York. College Bound after school enrichment. To expose our scholars to the world beyond their immediate neighborhood, MHCS coordinates opportunities for them to learn first hand about various industries and what it takes to be successful in each. Learning Journeys have included exposure to finance at Goldman Sachs, hospitality at Amali Restaurant, fashion design at C Ronson, environmental conservation at Rocking the Boat, and more. Scholars who have embodied our core values have the opportunity to travel abroad to learn about other cultures and ways of life. Part mentorship, part vocabulary and grammar lesson, and part training in the art of conversation, the MHCS Conversant Mentor Initiative pairs Scholars one-to-one with a professional adult. The adult shares his or her career path, introduces new vocabulary words, corrects common grammatical mistakes, and helps the Scholar hone the important skill of conversation. CER_MS_2012: Seeks to achieve quantum gains in every student's academic performance and in the quality of his or her life. Seeks to make sure all students are technologically literate.
WEBTEXT: TheMid-Michigan Leadership Academyis a highly regarded institution that provides a high-quality education to a diverse population in the Lansingarea. MMLA strives to help all students to achieve their full potential, prepare them for success in college, equip them with the ability and desire for lifelong learning, and strengthen their civic, ethical, and moral values. The school maintains high standards of efficiency and accountability throughout its operation. For more information about enrolling at MMLA, click here . CER_MS_2012: Fosters academic achievement within a nurturing environment. Our success is attributed to a dedicated and hard working staff, a well-rounded challenging curriculum, active parental involvement, and a community devoted to supporting education.
WEBTEXT: The recent California Assessment of Student Performance and Progress (CAASPP) scores reflect a âsnapshot' in time of our progress towards mastering the Common Core State Standards, but they donât tell the whole story,â said CUSD Superintendent Eric Andrew. âWe aredisaggregating these results and reviewing our other assessment data to pinpoint where we need to bolster our instructional practice and ensure that all of our students succeed.â He added that schools start this year with the newly adoptedcurriculum in our classrooms, 1-to-1 technology in nearly all grades, and students who are energized by the project-based learning we are able to provide through community partnerships. "We are going to leap ahead this year,â he said. As of September 7th, the testing company is still printing the individual student reports for our district schools. As soon as we receive them we will mail them to parents. Information about the State assessments and a link to the data is available at https://www.campbellusd.org/stateassessment . Please click the link below to find out more information the Marshall Lane Chess Club. marshall_lane_1st_session_2016-2017.pdf Friday, September 2nd at 8:30 in the staff lounge - First Principal Chat of the Year. Come hear about what is happening at Marshall Lane from Principal Priscilla Spencer and have a chance to ask questions. Monday, September 5th âNO SCHOOL forLabor Day Tuesday, September 6th -Auditions for our school play âAlice in Wonderland, Jr.â Please check the flyer from your Thursday envelope for details. Wednesday, September 14th -Back to School Night for 1st to 5th grades from 6:00 to 7:30. Thursday, September 15th -CUSD Board meeting @ 7:00 at the district office board room Tuesday, September 20th -PTA Meeting in the staff lounge at 7:00 p.m. Join us to find out about this important organization and upcoming events.Tuesday, September 27th -Teacher Appreciation Luncheonâ11:30 to 1:00 Friday, September 30th -Family Movie Night from 6:30 to 9:00. Hope to see you there! Our opening of school was very smooth this year. Thanks to the entire staff for their efforts to make this happen. We were happy to welcome all of our families back for the 2016-2017 school year. It is going to be a good one! SAFETY is our number one concern at Marshall Lane. Please help us to keep your children safe at school by following these important guidelines: We appreciate your help in keeping our campus safe for everyone. Thank you! Have you noticed the beautiful new building adjacent to our upper parking lot? It is the new home of our Campbell Care before and after school program. It contains a fabulous kitchen area and three spacious rooms for our students who participate in this program. Campbell Care is a great place to be! Susan Saba has been the administrative assistant at Marshall Lane for the past five years. She is an outstanding employee who was dedicated to helping all of the families at our school. Last spring, Susanâs family moved to Hollister. While she was hopeful that she could still remain in her job here, that has proven to be too difficult. Susanâs last day at Marshall Lane will be Friday, September 2nd. Our entire community thanks Susan for her years of service to our school. We will miss her and wish her well in her future endeavors. Our health clerk, Michelle Roberts, will be our new administrative assistant. She has worked in the district for the past ten years and has been at Marshall Lane for five years. As a community member and former PTA co-president at our school, Michelle is uniquely qualified for her new role. Please join me in congratulating and supporting her. The clerk job is currently posted. We will be interviewing and hiring a new person in this position in the upcoming weeks. As part of the Campbell Union School Districtâs effort to âgo greenâ, solar panels have been installed on the roof of several of our buildings. This project will be completed over the next few weeks and will begin to generate power for our school. With the new Campbell Care building on site, we were able to convert the old preschool and Campbell Care building into a bigger facility for our youngest students. The interior of the building was completely renovated over the summer and is now housing two preschool classes. Children from 2 to 4 years old may attend. For more information or to sign up please call (408) 341-7127. Partial and full day programs are available. During the first few weeks of school, our staff reviews the expectations that we have for our students. Our behavioral code is called STARS behavior which stands for: Safety First Take Responsibility Act with Integrity Remember Kindness Show Respect Ask your students to tell you what it means to them. Our speed limit is 15 mph or less. Use the crosswalks Drop students off on the campus side of your car using the designated drop off zones. Do not leave your vehicle. Before school, all students need to wait in the breezeway or in front of the school. Students must remain there and then line up outside their classrooms at 8:10. Respect the staff parking spaces and park in an unmarked space. Bikes and scooters must be walked on campus and locked up on the bike racks. CER_MS_2012: Alternative school for students with significant mental health and behavioral disabilities.
WEBTEXT: Manitowoc County Comprehensive School (MCCS) is where students with behavioral special needs can learn, excel, and work together for the best possible result. Our diversity, our respect for each person and our high expectations define who we are. As a community of students, staff, and families, we exist to foster an emotionally and physically safe and challenging learning environment for all members. We are a program of excellence. Academic achievement, personal responsibility, friendship, and honesty are at the heart of our success together. We care about each other enough to accept nothing less than everyone's best effort. SEARCH: LIFE CHARTER SCHOOL 800 EAST NORTH SHORE DR, HARTLAND, WI
ADDRESS: 800 EAST NORTH SHORE DR, HARTLAND, WI
CER_MS_2012: A community of learners that learn and investigate through fieldwork and organic farming experiences.
WEBTEXT: Note: This link can only be accessed through a computer located within the district. Picture Day is Wednesday, September 14, 2016 â Picture Day â¢ L earning Through Experience â¢ I nnovating Through Collaboration â¢ F ueling and Entrepreneurial Spirit â¢ E xcelling in Leadership, while building connections within our Community. LIFE Charter students will develop perseverance, professionalism and creativity. through entrepreneurial learning experiences and inquiry-based methods, students utilize personal learning plans to discover their passions. The result is a reflective, collaborative, innovative student that makes influential contributions to the learning environment and the local and global communities. Click HERE for even more information on LIFE Charter Middle School. LIFE Charter School is located inside of North Shore Middle School. LIFE (Learning Through Experience; Innovating Through Collaboration; Fueling an Entrepreneurial Spirit; Excelling in Leadership while building within Community) is a 6th-8th grade experience which focuses on helping students to develop perseverance, professionalism, and creativity through entrepreneurial learning experiences. The middle school math program is challenging and focuses on studentsâ ability to problem solve with an emphasis on explaining their reasoning skills both verbally and in writing. To enrich our mathematics program we have an Arrowhead High School math teacher on staff. Students who successfully pass geometry at the middle school are eligible to earn Arrowhead High School credit for the class. Students at LIFE Charter are engaged in learning through inquiry-based methods. A readers-writers workshop model is utilized for literacy instruction. Genius hour is a âhands-onâ time during the charter studentâs day where students are encouraged to delve deeper into topics that are of particular interest or are a passion for them. Students utilize inquiry-based methods to engage both during Genius Hour and during their entrepreneurial personal finance class. 6 th â 8 th Grade: 6 th â 8 th Grade: The comprehensive program extends into the middle school and features a variety of electives to match student interests, including: art, theatre, choir, musical performances, orchestra, band and jazz band. NSMSâs new STEM lab includes robotics, 3D printing and construction design. Our math program is challenging and ensures that students will meet and exceed high school expectations. To enrich our math program we have an Arrowhead High School teacher on staff at NSMS, which helps bridge the middle school math program with the high school math program. Part of the comprehensive curriculum is our state of the art STEM lab with 3D printing. The comprehensive teachers are collaborative and highly qualified by being certified in the content areas they teach in math, science and language arts. In a digital world, Hartland/Lakeside understands that many students learn well through the vast technological resources offered by our District. All of our classrooms have access to computers and iPads and incorporate many aspects of learning through technological media. Yet, our digital classrooms extend learning to a global venue where students interact with people from around the world. In addition, they are able to explore places and cultures different from their own environment, and learn firsthand from experts and scientists through a virtual interactive experience. Yet, one of the hallmarks of our digital classrooms is that they have become a model site of student and teacher learning and experiences that are shared with other staff members. As an example, digital classrooms have incorporated the use of Apple TV, where students can push their work wirelessly onto a large TV screen and where teachers use mobile devices to share videos and other visual learning cues. Another benefit to the digital classroom is enhanced communication with parents using various technological forms that were not available a few years back. This allows parents to have insights and information into their childâs daily schoolwork and learning expectations. The digital classrooms strive to develop an interactive and meaningful partnership where parents play a daily role with the teacher in their childâs education. Hartland/Lakeside offers onecharter schooland three magnet schoolsacross the K-8 grades. The charter consists of a K-2 fine arts schooland the two magnet schools offera 3-5-community learning multi-grade school, and a 6-8 entrepreneurial school. At Hartland/Lakeside, we understand that children learn differently and that the learning environment can play a role in how their engagement and motivation is expressed. Our charter and magnet schools provide alternative learning opportunities, where students can connect their interests to curricular objectives and extend their learning using approaches that work better for them. LIFE Charter Middle School Instructions for online resources Hartland-Lakeside is a community oriented school district with high quality programs and services. It is located in the Village of Hartland, Wisconsin, and serves the Village of Hartland and the Towns of Delafield, Merton, and Pewaukee. The Hartland Lakeside School Districtâs Mission is to provide a diverse and dynamic educational program that meets the unique learning styles of all students. The Hartland Lakeside School District PTO is excited to have joined forces with the PTOs from Hartland South and North Shore Middle School. Working together with the Hartland Lakeside Education Foundation. For more information of the Hartland Lakeside School District PTO, contact Lori Ciesko . There are always many ways for parents to become involved. Please click one of the links below to find opportunities in each of our buildings. CER_MS_2012: Enables children who have been educationally underserved to develop the knowledge, skills and character necessary to succeed in top quality high schools, colleges and the competitive world beyond.
WEBTEXT: KIPP Aspire Academy is a free public middle school (grades 5th - 8th). Our mission is to help our students cultivate the academic skills, intellectual habits, and character traits necessary to be successful in the top quality high schools, colleges, and the competitive world beyond. KIPP Aspire Academy will offer an unparalleled education, empowering our community one student at a time. SEARCH: KIPP GENERATIONS COLLEGIATE 500 EAST TIDWELL, HOUSTON, TX
CER_MS_2012: A national network of free, open-enrollment, college-preparatory public schools with a track record of preparing students in underserved communities for success in college and in life.
WEBTEXT: KIPP Generations Collegiate (KGC) opened its doors the fall of 2011 and serves college-bound 9th - 12th-grade students from Houstonâs North and East communities.The academic and co-curricular programs at KGC provide a college-preparatory experience that empowers students with the knowledge, skills, and mindsets to go to and through college. At KIPP Generations Collegiate we believe that education provides choice for a future.We envision a generation of college ready critical thinkers who take responsibility for their learning and who contribute actively by giving back and paying forward.Our scholars will enter a college or university setting with an understanding that where they are from is very much a part of who they were meant to become, and the realization of their educational ambitions can change the trajectory of their futures, their familyâs future, and the community from which they belong.We will generate graduates who will âbe the change [we] wish to see in the worldâ. Service Learning Citizenship is one of KGCâs core values.To honor this value, we require our students to complete at least 80 hours of service learning activities to graduate.Instead of simply volunteering, our scholars integrate community service activities with an academic study to enrich learning, teach civic responsibility, and strengthen our community.Furthermore, we have at least one week during each school year devoted to service learning activities.At KGC, we believe that âWe Lift as We Climbâ and that our studentâs successes are rooted in the successes of those who came before and after us.As a new generation of hope, KGC will seek to establish mentoring roles with its feeder middle schools, KIPP 3D Academy (North Houston) and KIPP Intrepid Preparatory School (East End). KGC provides a rigorous college-preparatory education with an emphasis on reading, writing, and critical thinking. In addition to graduation requirements set by the Texas Education Agency, students at KGC will receive ongoing support to develop organizational skills and study habits that will enable them to be successful in college and beyond through our Collegiate Pathway.Students must gain acceptance into a four-year college or university as a high school graduation requirement.Our curriculum features: KIPP Houston | 10711 KIPP Way | Houston, TX 77099 | Phone: 832.328.1051 | Contact Us About Mission Past. This design creates an environment in which students feel encouraged to explore and learn. Fun, excitement, curiosity, and engagement â these things make joyful learners. Our student work is meaningful and based in inquiry. We invite you to see for yourself. Learn more about our diverse offerings and how to join our school. See more information about Finance . Read More We are in need of parent volunteers to assist K and 1st grade teachers (5 classes) as we borrow their aides to fulfill a high priority task at the front office and other areas. Read More It is the policy of HPS not to discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, or disability in its programs, services, or activities as required by Title VI of the Civil Rights Act of 1964, as amended; Title IX of the Education Amendments of 1972; and Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act of 1973, as amended. For inquiries regarding non-discrimination policies, please contact Section 504/ADA Coordinator at (713) 343-3333 located at 9321 W. Sam Houston Pkwy S. Houston, TX 77099. } else if ('top' != 'none') { circle_timer_animate_0.stop(); } } } }); Highland Free School has been a part of the Tucson community since 1970. Located in the Barrio San Antonio neighborhood (just south of the U of A), Highland is a non-profit elementary school that provides students from across the metropolitan area with a unique academic environment. Our School Features STEM and Social Studies Integrated Thematic Units Project-Based Learning Low Student/Teacher Ratios Multi-age Classrooms Parental Involvement Advanced Technology Hands-On Activities General School Information The educational philosophy at Highland is based upon the fact that children are naturally inquisitive and excited by learning. Our goal is to keep that inquisitiveness alive. Our curriculum is aligned with the Arizona College and Career Ready Standards and includes integrated, thematic units that often use hands-on, innovative activities and projects designed to give students practice in applying the Arizona educational standards while strengthening their twentieth-century skills of creativity, collaboration, and communication. SEARCH: ANIMO SOUTH LOS ANGELES CHARTER 11130 W.ERN AVE, LOS ANGELES, CA
CER_NAME: Animo South Los Angeles Charter High School
CER_MS_2012: College-prep curriculum grounded by a commitment to high expectations, parent involvement, student leadership and technology.
WEBTEXT: We are focused on graduating students and fully preparing them for college. In addition, Green Dot is dedicated to helping parents organize and expect more of their neighborhood schools. We achieve better student outcomes and higher graduation rates serving students who need the most, lower per-pupil funding, and a unionized workforce. We arethe leading independent non-profit public school operator in Los Angeles andone of the top three largest in the nation. The U.S. Department of Education has featured Green Dot as a national leader in school turnarounds, and we are the only school network in the country to leadthe turnaround of a large high school (3,000+ students) "Green Dot reminds me why I grew up wanting to be a teacher. I feel like I'm working toward something bigger here, and I believe in what we're doing every day." - William Heuisler, History Teacher At Green Dot, our mission is to help transform public education so ALL students graduate prepared for college, leadership, and life. We make this possible by hiring passionate teachers, administrators, and staff who believe in our students' potential. IsGreen Dot right for you? Green Dot Public Schools is a network of public charter schools in Los Angeles, California; Memphis, Tennessee; and Tacoma, Washington. Our middle schools offer grades six to eight, and our high schools offer grades nine to 12. Our schools are free and open to all students, like other public schools. Our Approach. Green Dotâs academic model is designed to meet individual student needs, combining a rigorous curriculum with the academic counseling and support students need to succeed. Our Results. Now serving more than 12,000 students, Green Dothas graduated more than 6,500 students with more than 90% of our graduating seniors being accepted to college. Our API scores show sustained student growth and U.S. News and World Report has ranked our schools among the very best in the nation. Each Green Dot school shares the common mission of preparing our students for college, leadership and life . Helpopen great public schools thatdeliver on the promise of closing historic achievement gaps, and give all students an equal opportunity to succeed incollege, leadership and life . Eight Green Dot high schools are ranked among the top 10% of schools nationally by US News & World Report , with four being in the top 5%. Students enter Green Dot schools testing in the bottom 10% but are matching the graduation rate for the state. These same students are 4 times more likely to graduate college-ready than students in neighboring schools. You may come into our office or download an application below. Completed applications can be emailed to Gloria Soto at gsoto@craneschools.org . If you have any questions or would like to schedule a tour please email Jamie Haines, Principal, at Jhaines@craneschools.org or contact us at 928-539-1200. Lunch times are as follows: Kinder - 10:55 - 11:35 1st Grade - 11:10 - 11:45 2nd Grade - 11:20 - 11:55 3rd Grade - 11:30 - 12:05 4th Grade - 11:40 - 12:15 5th Grade - 11:50 - 12:25 6th Grade - 12:00 - 12:35 Gowan Science Academy Mission and Vision Vision: Gowan Science Academy provides a challenging inquiry-based Science Technology, Engineering and Math (STEM) curriculum to maximize individual potential and ensure students thrive in a global community. Mission: Gowan Science Academy offers an educational option for students to pursue their interests in the areas of Science, Technology, Engineering and Math. Students are pushed to maximize their individual potential and empowered to explore the world in which they live. Collaborative partnerships are created between students, teachers, families and the community to ensure success for all students.
